item.title: Pure Bar
item.body: Concept bar with oriental and designer interior. Unusual teas, shishas, lassys, cocktails, oxygen bar, etc. Open 9 p.m. - 1 a.m.

item.title: La Samaritaine
item.body: Café with show, literary cabaret, in a fine vaulted cellar. Closed Sunday and Monday Open 7.30 p.m. - end of the shows

item.title: Le Can Can
item.body: Gay bar with show on Thursday evening (at 22h), karaoke on Friday and show on Saturday

item.title: Le Cercueil
item.body:
In pure sinister-kitsch style, undertakers as friendly as prison gates serve you beers in skulls! And make you pay (dearly) for the pleasure.

When: weekdays 4 p.m. - 2 a.m. / Friday&Saturday 1 p.m. - 4 a.m. / Sunday 1 p.m. - 1 a.m.

item.title: Havana
item.body:
Tasteful chat-up lines, cocktails served by a real barman "like in the movies" and supercharged ambience are the memorable elements of this bar-restaurant-nightclub with the scents of caïpirinha, pisco, mojito and other drinks straight from the Tropics.
Also huge database of music from which to draw to create just the right mood at just the right hour. Looking for some upbeat lounge before midnight and some funky dance beats later on? No problem. We’ll provide all of the hardware and the engineer and DJ to run it.

Open Wednesday to Saturday from 7 p.m.

item.title: Goupil le Fol
item.body:
Bar (French chanson) - We love Goupil! For its dimly-lit labyrinthine layout with weird decor, for its juke box that plays Piaf, Brel or Ferré non-stop until the wee small hours, for its insomniac, chocolate-dispensing owner, for its fruity wines and, well, and for its good old cosy couches that you can sink into slowly.

Open every day from 8 p.m. til very late

item.title: Le Laboureur
item.body: With its wooden tables, flipper machine and impromptu terrace, this is a little gem of a bistro. The completely crazy lady of the house adds to the charm.

item.title: Le Roy d'Espagne
Estaminet du Théâtre Royal de Toone
item.address: Rue Marché aux Herbes 66 - Impasse Sainte-Pétronille/66 Grasmarkt - Impasse Sainte-Pétronille

item.title: Flat (The)
item.body: A unique lounge bar full of charm that takes you down through relaxing and friendly rooms, an after business bar and a party place for expats & locals.

item.title: James Joyce
item.body:
The oldest Irish pub in Brussels is also the most classic of its kind here. Creamy Guinness flowing freely, European officials with distinctive accents and heated discussions in front of a permanently lit football screen. Brussels is also a bit like that.

Open from 5 p.m., WE from midday

item.title: O'Reilly's
item.body: (Rock-pop / Hits) - This is, without doubt, the biggest Irish pub in the capital, so big that it had to open new premises a few yards farther along for its regulars and passing tourists. St Patrick reigns supreme here, which means: leather wall seats, non-stop sport on TV and copious amounts of Guinness. You can also enjoy the dimly-lit nooks and crannies there and a terrace with view over the Bourse, where you're sure to be heard. Cheers. Open from 1 p.m. to 1 a.m.; WE 4 a.m.

item.title: L'Ultime Atome
item.body:
L'Ultime Atome is a sort of driving force of the Saint-Boniface district. In a perfect location, it offers a brasserie setting where trendy youth and an assorted public put the world to rights. Here, it's the customers who select the music, and there's a list of a hundred or so beers and some well-chosen wines.

Open every day from 11 a.m. to 1.30 a.m.

item.title: Le Tavernier
item.body:
(Jazzbreak / Electro) - Undoubtedly the trendiest place in the area around the Université Libre de Bruxelles. Despite a vast terrace area and interior space, it's not always easy to find somewhere to sit. Not to worry, you can always lean on the bar and order a local Vedett or sway your hips to the jazz-break beats that throb out there almost every weekend evening.

When: 11 a.m. till midnight (Sunday), till 1 a.m. (week), till 2 a.m. WE

item.title: Sounds Jazz Club
item.body: The Sounds is a jazz institution in Brussels. And it's fair to say that it has a full programme. Every day except Sunday, blue note addicts come to hear those double basses, pianos and drums in this little space located close to Place Fernand Cocq. Wednesday is devoted to more Latino sounds. Open from 8 p.m.

item.title: Dolle Mol
item.body: Welcome to the centre of Brussels anarchy. The café has rudimentary décor and is supported by several artists, including the film maker Jan Bucquoy.

item.title: Java
item.body: Impressive trendy-alternative bar Wednesday to Saturday; blues and jam sessions on Sunday. Open 7 p.m. till dawn

item.title: Belgica
item.body:
Born on July 21 -the Belgian national day- the Belgica quickly became the place to be for Brussels' artists, musicians, actors and fashion stylists regardless of language or origin.

Open Thursday to Sunday from 10 p.m. to 3 a.m.
item.address: rue du Marché au Charbon 32/32 Kolenmarkt

item.title: Bazaar
item.body:
Le Bazaar is situated right in the heart of Les Marolles. A big hot-air balloon above the bar and copious quantities of candles feature in a decor reminiscent of the tales from a thousand and one nights. This is where lovers come for a bite to eat or a drink. In the basement, you dance until the small hours beneath the vaulted ceiling amidst a flashy new decor and barmaids ready to serve you some bracing Gin Fizzes.

Open 7.30 p.m. to midnight; WE 'til 4 a.m.

item.title: Coaster
item.body:
Cocktail bar ( House / Hits) - It's true, the place isn't big, but its reputation for late-night partying is well established. Two solutions, both good ones: 1. Arrive early and make the most of the flexible happy hours starting at 8 p.m. 2. Arrive after midnight when heads are already spinning a little and bodies jam-packed. Either way, they always end up dancing on the tables.

Open from 8 p.m.

item.title: De Markten
item.body: This bistro-bar near the Place Sainte- Catherine has a nice terrace under the trees.
item.address: 5 Place du Vieux Marché aux Grains,/Oude Graanmarkt, 5

item.title: Le Corbeau
item.body: The great classic involves downing a Chevalier, a beer served in an oddly-shaped litre glass, without dribbling. Above and beyond this colourful experience, the place is quite popular in the evening among an eccentric mix of young people who can quickly get things going. Open from 10 a.m. to 1 a.m.; WE 4 a.m.

item.title: Canoa Quebrada
item.body:
Canoa Quebrada Bar / Nightclub (Salsa/Brazil) - A Latino club for dropping in after midnight when the crowds start to flock there to enjoy caïpirinhas and other pick-me-up cocktails. There you can dance the salsa and, in the wee small hours, the place often turns into a local "revolución".

Open from 10 p.m.

item.title: Le Cercle des voyageurs
item.body: A skilful blend of tearoom and tourist office for travellers in search of something new. As you might imagine, the Cercle is not a place where you dance on the tables, gulping from a bottle. Instead, you go there to relax in a refined setting, a sort of nice, cosy space from the colonial age. The comfortable couches, ornamental mouldings in the form of a planisphere and a travel book area (for leafing through to your heart's content) go perfectly with exquisite nectars, alcoholic or otherwise, from all over the world. Open every day from 11 a.m. to 1 a.m.

item.title: Bar du Matin
item.body:
A friendly place and very interesting musical programme from jazz to electro, chanson to world music! Depending on the day of the week and the vagaries of the weather, the atmosphere moves inside and outside onto lovely big terrace area.
When: 8 a.m till 1 a.m., WE till 2 a.m.

item.title: Café Novo
item.body: With a terrace in the front and a garden behind, the Café Novo is the perfect place to eat whenever the sun is out. It's just near the Manneken Pis.
item.address: Place de la Vieille Halle aux Blés 7/7 Oud Korenhuis

item.title: La Mort Subite
item.body:
As tradition demands, dropping in at this temple to the most "brrrrruseleers" specialities of the capital is a must. The public fluctuates between serious-minded people in their fifties and sharp bons viveurs. And you can sample Faros, Kriek and other Gueuze beers there, with an open fromage frais sandwich in hand. A classic that's still going strong.

Open every day from 10 a.m. to midnight
item.address: rue Montagne aux Herbes Potagères 7/7 Warmoesberg

item.title: Café Bota
item.body: Café Bota, in the buildings of the Botanique, invites you to enjoy the excellent Italian cuisine and a fine selection of wines. Café Bota consists of three spaces: a modern urban bar, a cosy restaurant and the botanical gardens of Botanique. You will be served with grace and style by our young and dynamic team. Café Bota Stereo is a musical encounter on Friday and Saturday with renowned artists. To listen, but also to dance!

item.title: Châlet Robinson
item.body: A renowned, out-of-the-ordinary location in the very heart of the Bois de la Cambre, on the Ile Robinson (Robinson's Island) is an exceptional site. The perfect setting for events of all kinds - receptions, gala dinners, walking dinners, marriages and sports ceremonies .
item.address: Bois de la cambre - 1, Sentier de l'Embarcadère/Ter Kamernebos - 1, Sentier de l'Embarcadère

item.title: Chez Maman
item.body:
One of the most famous gay bars in Brussels is known as Chez Maman (At Mom's) and is known for its fabulous drag shows. The bar is usually packed with people during the weekends, when you can see "Maman" and other transvestites dazzle with gay's inspired song performances on the bar counter.

Friday and Saturday from midnight

item.title: Clovers' Bar
item.body: The trendiest place in Boitsfort

item.title: People
item.address: avenue de la Toison d'Or 12/12 Guldenvlieslaan

item.title: Mappa Mundo
item.body: This big bar that looks like a caravel has a terrace area in the perfect location (and heated when necessary). The Mappa is also well-known for its international crowd and its wood-lined labyrinths. Sometimes you meet young people from the Dansaert district here, sometimes slightly sozzled expats. A Les Halles classic where you can also sip a few well-chilled fruit juices. Open every day from 10 a.m. to 2 a.m.
item.address: rue du Pont de la Carpe 2-6/2-6 Karperbrug

item.title: Barabar
item.body:
The Barabar is first and foremost an undeniable "legend " of the Brussels' nightlife scene. It continues intact whatever the prevailing trends and fashions, unwavering and unchanged, with its Ladies dancing on the tables, its good-humoured easy spirit and its immutable "Kicker". For 30 years, people have been celebrating within its four walls. And it doesn't look like that'll change anytime soon.

Open everyday from 6PM till3 AM or later. Happy hour between 6 and 10 PM.

item.title: Boudoir Louise@Barsey
item.body:
With its ideal location in the prestigious Avenue Louise, Barsey exudes an atmosphere of freedom. The restaurant and lounge bar will always seduce with its cosy surroundings any time of the day under any circumstances. Located in the restaurant, the bar offers everything one would expect from a lounge: delectable finger food, relaxation before and after a show, a "Music Menu" for a lounge evening with resident DJ's during week-ends.

Open from noon until 2 pm on weekdays and from 7 pm until 10 pm from Monday to Saturday.

item.title: Les Halles Saint-Géry
item.body: This ancient indoor market, transformed into a bar and exhibition centre, has a terrace adjoining the building. Tables are besieged as soon as the sun shines, but thankfully the area has plenty of other terraces.

item.title: Walvis
item.body: On the edge of the canal, this café is the meeting place for all the bobos of the Dansaert district. The crowd spills over onto a rudimentary terrace by the sidewalk in fine weather.

item.title: Bar du Marché
item.body: A friendly place and very interesting musical programme from jazz to electro, chanson to world music! Depending on the day of the week and the vagaries of the weather, the atmosphere moves inside and outside onto lovely big terrace area.

item.title: Au Bon Vieux Temps
item.body:
Antiques, quiet and typical café.

Open 11 a.m. - midnight; WE 2 a.m.

item.title: Balmoral
item.body: With its juke box and figurines of Betty Boop and Marilyn, this blue and pink café takes you back to America in the 60's - complete with milk shakes and club sandwiches.

item.title: A l'Imaige Nostre-Dame
item.body:
For typical "bruxellois" madness, this is the place to go. It could be said that the establishment is almost as old as the city itself, and lounging around here is like seeing time stand still. Wooden furniture, rustic bar and special beers, this place has a rare authenticity. Tasting the "Bourgogne de Flandre", of course, highly recommended.

Open from midday to midnight; Saturday 3 p.m. - 2 a.m.; Sunday 4 p.m. 'til midnight
item.address: rue du Marché-aux-Herbes, Impasse des Cadeaux 3/3 Grasmarkt, Geschenkengang

item.title: Barapaat
item.body: A rather eccentric bar, but deliciously kitsch. Décor is highlighted by a mishmash of busts of Christ, religious pictures and other godly goods.

item.title: L'Atelier
item.body:
L'Atelier has acquired a new image but has lost none of its charm. Its enormous beer list still holds pride of place on the wall and it's difficult not to find a Trappist to your liking. Because it has around 400 kinds of the delicious brew that's so much a part of Brussels and Belgium.

Open every day 'til late

item.title: Beurskafee
item.body:
(Electro / Break / Jazz) - The Beurs is first and foremost an amazing Flemish cultural venue that, with its contemporary design, has made its mark. So its long bar leaves room for a rather artistic and intellectual crowd. Music is ubiquitous, including DJ sets and live music for the initiated. In the evenings, they lounge around big communal tables in a general but very friendly and sociable hubbub, before moving to the various upstairs rooms and dancing the night away.

When: Thursday to Saturday from 7.30 p.m

item.title: Booze'n Blues
item.body:
When: From 7 p.m. till till dawn
What: Cozy blues bar famous for its late hours. The juke box is loaded with little gems, mainly timeless rock classics.

item.title: Bizon
item.body:
Nice little bar where jam sessions, blues and special vodkas come together year round. Don't miss the Bizon blood at 4.50 € and other stimulating vodkas as well as the concerts on Monday night.

Open 6 p.m. - late
item.address: rue du Pont de la Carpe 7 /7 Karperbrug

item.title: Café central (Le)
item.body:
(House / Funk / Electro) - Although not so central as other Les Halles venues, this café is well worth a "quick" detour in itself. There's sure to be a lively and trendy ambience there all year round thanks to the mini-concerts, themed film screenings and wicked DJ sets (all free). However packed it is in the central space, that's never stopped the smooth-talkers and flirts from swaying their hips to a good track or two, as varied as they are numerous.

Open every evening

item.title: Café Belga
item.body:
Its terrace is a must, its trendy music and colourful atmosphere have made it a classic of Brussels' night life. We still don't understand why but the building site that serves as the skyline still hasn't put off the crowds from flocking there en masse. It must be a Belgian thing, really surrealistic. We like that.

Open from 8 a.m. to 2 a.m.; WE 3 a.m.

item.title: Café Kafka
item.body: Café Kafka offers an amazing selection of the finest belgian beers, along with a wide range of high quality drinks and spirits. But the legendary café kafka is not just about the best beers in the world. It's also about a truly warm atmosphere. About meeting awesome people from all walks of life. About the music. About the concerts.

item.title: Dali's Bar
item.body:
At the end of a strange blue corridor, one of the oldest electro bars in the city emerges into view. In this inevitably surrealist place, you sink into lip-shaped sofas whilst admiring the canvasses of the Master himself (fakes, we're assured) and sipping one of the explosive cocktails - the blue or the red one, it's a matter of taste. And then, there's the music, which will always reign supreme here, whether it's on the main floor or in the basement, where there's hardly an evening without people jumping around. Drum'n bass, house, reggae, down tempo' Wait and see.

Open Thursday to Saturday from 10 p.m. 'til late
item.address: Petite rue des Bouchers 35 /35 Korte Beenhouwersstraat

item.title: De Skieven Architek
item.body: When the weather is fine, the terrace of this modest little bistro attracts stall-holders and bargain hunters from the Place du Jeu de Balle. Open 5 a.m. - 10 p.m.
item.address: place du Jeu de Balle 50/50 Vossenplein

item.title: Delirium Café
item.body:
(Blues /Rock) - Officially, 2004 beers but actually 2500 depending on the season, that's the credo of this cul-de-sac bar, which is home to the sister of the famous Manneken-Pis. At the Delirium, conversation naturally revolves around beer, some flambéed, others with a greenish colour or else served in 4-litre glasses. That certainly quenches your thirst. You can also taste no fewer than 500 Dutch gins and delicious pure malt whiskies here. All things considered, a nice place and very flexible opening hours.

Open until 4 a.m. and Sunday until 1 a.m.

item.title: La Tentation
item.body: Bar / Dance room (Spanish / Latino) - A great place dedicated to Galician traditions. Its 1000 m² of surface area is mapped out horizontally by a long, welcoming bar and vertically by a series of columns with large, round tables in the centre, where you can debate to the sound of Iberian rhythms. N.B. dance lessons and frequent live music. Open from 10 a.m. - 11 p.m.; WE 'til late

item.title: L'Archiduc
item.body:
The hazy charm of the Archiduc always works. Its thirties decor has something to do with it, of course, as do its armchairs and round balcony. Concerts are often held there around the famous grand piano (on WE from 5 p.m.), which occupies pride of place in the middle of it. Also to be enjoyed at the end of the evening, when you can come across a famous singer or two.

Open every day from 5 p.m. 'til late.

item.title: Le Roi des Belges
item.body: This is one of the places in Les Halles that's known for its successful, subtle mix of genres. You'll find a modern industrial style on the ground floor and a space characterised by very distinct seventies trends upstairs. That's where passing DJs hold court some evenings. Open every day from 10 a.m. to 2 a.m.; WE 3 a.m.
item.address: rue Jules van Praet 35-37/35-37 Jules Van Praetstraat

item.title: Smoods
item.body: Imagine a living room that is both cosy and funky. Comfortable and stimulating. Distinctive and at the same time familiar. Smoods is a unique place in Brussels, unlike any other. The décor features 7 distinctive mood islands: Passion, Safari, Bling-Bling, Aqua, Bazaar, Spring and Flower Power.

item.title: Sheraton Brussels Airport
item.body: Piano bar

item.title: La Fleur en Papier Doré / het Goudblommeke van Papier
item.body:
The HQ of the Belgian surrealist movement in the 1920s, this quaint bar has managed to retain its old-world charm. This is the place to come to experience a particularly rare atmosphere rather than to drink yourself into oblivion.

Hergé was a frequent visitor to this bar with its illustrious past, where he came to enjoy a refreshing gueuze. This was the meeting place for the figureheads of Belgian surrealism of the twentieth century at the time of René Magritte, but it was also a favourite watering hole for Pierre Alechinsky, Louis Scutenaire and Jacques Brel. Today, the café is still a favourite among the artistic and literary crowd.

Since May 2011, the interior courtyard of the Fleur en Papier Doré displays a comic strip fresco by the cartoonists De Marck and De Wulf (Stam et Pilou).
Open from 11 a.m. to 1 a.m.; WE 3 a.m.

item.title: Wax Club
item.body:
Jazz aperitifs, house parties, plenty of rum ans a sweeping view over the city centre

When: Thu. & Sat. 10 p.m. till late

item.title: Floris Bar
item.body:
1 ST, THE ABSINTH: after several decades, when it was forbidden; absinth, this nectar Who inspired the genius of artists like RIMBAUD , VERLAINE, WILDE, TOULOUSE-LAUTREC, MODIGLIANI,HEMINGWAY and many others, is NEWLY LEGALIZED. The FLORIS BAR offers the MOST varieties of absinths never available Before to the public. In accordance with the traditional ceremonial of service, with A spoon, a fontain, or in the bohemian fashion, burns in informer days. FOR THE FIRST TIME IN BELGIUM , EUROPE AND WORLDWIDE...

When: 8 p.m.- 6 a.m.

item.title: Fontainas
item.body:
As café terraces go, the Fontainas has real class. 80 chairs where you can gossip in the sunshine and ideally situated for a little game of seeing and being seen. There you cross paths with artists with square-framed spectacles, motley trendy looks and well-turned-out gays. Kitsch decor, pedestrianised street and snacks are the bonuses at this really nice place.

Open every day from midday

item.title: Greenwich Taverne
item.body: The Greenwich, a listed cafe, is well worth a visit. It owes its reputation in particular to the fact that it was the temple of chess and that Magritte often played there with other personalities that mixed in Brussels' surrealist circles.

item.title: Het Warm water
item.body:
Speciality: breakfast. Snacks and Brussels-style cabaret.

Open Thursday to Saturday 8 a.m. - 10 p.m.; Sunday to Tuesday 8 a.m. -7 p.m.

item.title: In het Spinnekopke
item.body:
There are a thousand and one reasons to discover this cosy pub. Timber-clad walls and wooden benches, a scattering of old beer adverts on the walls or again waiters in a long white apron, the little details that make this bar a great find.

And if the atmosphere wasn't enough, the taste and originality of the lovingly prepared dishes will only convince you to cross the atypical entrance of the "Inn of the Little Spider".
item.address: place du Jardin aux Fleurs 1/1 Bloemenhofplein

item.title: La Bécasse
item.body:
Old-style setting, typical beers and cosmopolitan atmosphere

Open 10 a.m.- midnight; WE 1 a.m.

item.title: Le Duquesnoy
item.body:
The gay mens cruising bar fetish of brussels with a musical selection. jeans, rubber, leather and sneaker highly recommended. check our thema on the agenda.
 
 
Open Monday to Saturday from 9 p.m.; Sunday from 3 p.m.

item.title: The Hairy Canary
item.body: The place draws in a more "suit and tie" public than any other Irish pub. So, within the dark walls and among the green leather armchairs, you'll also find a straighter ambience here than elsewhere. Not to worry, there are Happy Hours from 5 p.m., which usually warm things up very quickly.

item.title: Guru Bar
item.body:
Just a step or two away from Flagey, a hip new place with fusion cuisine, DJ's at the weekend and "hyper" barman.

Open every day from 10 a.m. 'til 1 p.m., WE 3 a.m.

item.title: Le Waff café
item.body: The Waff is one of those places where you can't say if it is a restaurant, a bar or a small disco. But onbe thing is sure: people likes the concept!

item.title: Soleil (Au)
item.body: This is a very agreeable café in the centre of town, with an equally agreeable terrace that spills over onto a little pedestrian street. Open 10 a.m.- 1 a.m.; WE 2 a.m.

item.title: Le Cabaret aux Chansons
item.body: Music with lyrics, jazz and original compositions live. Open 1st Thursday of the month, Friday and Saturday evening 8 p.m. - late
item.address: rue du Marché aux Fromages 22bis Kaasmarkt

item.title: The Wood
item.body:
The Wood opened in the heart of the heritage site of the Bois de la Cambre in one of the oldest buildings in the park dating back to 1880.
After a complete renovation of the place, Carl De Moncharline and Serge Vanderheyden have entrusted the interior design to several talented artists.
 
The bar offers a magnificent terrace in the heart of the wood. It welcomes you from Wednesday to Saturday, programming the best DJs to be today's reference for Brussels nightlife.

item.title: The Music Village
item.body: In a 17th-century house, you'll find all the charm of New York jazz bars with a succession of crooners and big bands every evening. The programme is high quality and the biggest names in jazz have set foot on this stage, which has become a benchmark in the genre. If your pocket tells you that this isn't for you, no more excuses because they've just introduced a student deal for 7.50 €. Open from 8.30 p.m. (for live music evenings, see Website diary)

item.title: Royal
item.body: This Brussels institution has just re-opened after disappearing for many years. A mythic brasserie that you must visit - even if it's just for a look!

item.title: Roxi
item.body: Close by the very "look-at-me" Châtelain district, the Roxi holds its own with some real touches of originality. Thursday evening concerts, ultra-trendy decor and rather pleasant dining. Open every day from 8 a.m. to 1 a.m.; WE 3 a.m.

item.title: TIBV lounge-bar
item.body:
Le tibv lounge-bar propose une très large variété d'alcools telles qu'une soixantaine de vodkas, une vingtaine de whiskies, une cinquantaine de cocktails, ainsi que de bons vins et de bons champagnes. Chaque jour s'associe à une humeur différente c'est-à-dire un style de musique différent pour chaque soir à voir dans l'agenda.

When: 6 p.m. till 1 a.m. (Wed.), 5 a.m. (Thu.), WE 4 a.m.

item.title: Pixel
item.body: À deux pas du Sablon, ce bar à vin a ouvert ses portes en octobre 2009 et propose également une petite restauration réjouissante, allant des potages aux wraps. Dans un décor imaginé et conçu par lui-même, le designer belge Charles Kaisin a achevé son "pixel bar". En effet, pour un amateur de vin, il a eu l'idée de pixelliser la photo d'un paysage bucolique fait de milliers de petits cubes de tissus aux couleurs variées. L'ambiance y est conviviale et chaleureuse, propice aux soirées entre amis.

item.title: Bar “Le 31”
item.body:
Located in the majestic lobby of the Hotel Metropole, the Bar "Le 31" is more than just a bar in Brussels. It is the place to be downtown.
Re-decorated in 2011 in a "End of 19th century" style, you will enjoy relaxing and comfortable moments in a new and prestigious decor.

The colourful frescoes, the new furniture designed by Ms Sandrine Saint Hilaire from the Cartisane Decor S.A., the Belle Époque lamps will fascinate guests seeking comfort, luxury and privacy. For privileged moments, our pianist will entertain your evening 2 times a week, on Thursday and Friday, from 8 p.m. until 10 p.m.

A new name, a new decor, a new drinks menu, cocktails, whiskies and champagnes, new musical styles, everything has been designed to accommodate the businessman, the tourist or the regulars visiting the De Brouckère place.
 
• Open from Tuesday to Saturday from 04.30 p.m. until 00.30 a.m.
• Closed on Sunday, Monday and holiday
• Live piano entertainment, on Thursday and Friday, from 8 p.m. to 10 p.m.
• Happy Hour, from Tuesday to Thursday, from 6.30 p.m. to 8 p.m.

item.title: Mokafe
item.body: A philosophy bar in the city centre: every 1st and 3rd Monday in the month at 20h

item.title: SAS Brasserie
item.body: A short wait at gare du Midi railway station

item.title: L'Homo Erectus Classicus
item.body: Tweed bar with soft music. The little brother of Homo Erectus around the corner. Here you go for a quiet coffee or tea.

item.title: L'Homo Erectus
item.body: Friendly and unpretentious.

item.title: MGM Café
item.body: MGM Cafe, Simply the best Karaoke in Brussels.

item.title: Midi Station
item.body:
Thousands of travellers, onlookers, tourists, visitors, Belgians or people from Brussels, Flemish and Walloons now have a reference point for all their gatherings. The Midi Station, an eclectic location which spans over 2000 M² right next door to the Thalys and Eurostar.
 
Midi Station is diverse and unmatched : a secure underground car park is available to hundreds of cars. Come out of the elevator and head towards the centre of the yellow colored building sheltering your car.
 
After the covered and heated terrasse, a luminous table several meters long mounted with giant pots awaits your arrival.
 
Open spaces, 6 meter tall birches, Mediterranean grease plants, brewery, bar, cigar lounge, private lounges, centralised dance floor equipped with the latest DJ and VJ gear, "comfy" chairs in which to relax, luminous tables on which you can sign contracts, scarps to read the paper or check your messages, scientific acoustics, pure sound, stupendous commodities, mezzanines, winter garden, conference rooms for business or private events.
 
So where can you find us? In Brussels yes, but in a location that most capitals will
covet since they can only offer the standard Station snackbar to their visitors.

item.title: L'Unique Resto-Bar Lounge
item.body: MGM Cafe, Simply the best Karaoke in Brussels.
item.address: 98 rue Edith Cavell /98 Edith Cavell straat

item.title: SETT
item.body: Looking for a place to escape the daily stress? Or enjoy an exhilarating moment with friends or even more..., Sett's brasserie opens it's doors and welcomes you within a both intimate and elegant framework at Tour & Taxis. The real luxury offered by a fashionable 'brasserie' is having the favorable time to simple enjoy products of high standard and as such share a moment to remember in a cosy environment. Titillating and restful at the same time, you will have the opportunity to meet satisfaction and happiness with a careful staff, attentive to your requests. We invite you to come and share those delightful moments.

item.title: Celtica
item.body: Live music every Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday - always free entrance. Every day in Celtica, from 1pm until midnight, you can drink at what must be the cheapest prices outside the supermarkets with our fantastic Happy Hours prices on bottled drinks.

item.title: City Club
item.body:
In the historic heart of Brussels, a few steps from the Grand’Place, one of the most beautiful
market squares in the world, you will find the brand-new City Club Brussels.
 
The discotheque, whose official opening took place in December 2009, has the most up-to-date
technologies for both sound and light. There you will discover a surprising setting, both urbane and
enchanting, where you will dance under a starry dome while surrounded by giant aquariums.
 
A short ride on the lift will allow our most demanding guests to relax in a real VIP space on the first floor,
where they will find themselves among friends and enjoy exceptional service, all the while continuing to
benefit from the sound and the ambience of the discotheque.
 
The City Club Brussels is open starting at 11pm on Fridays & Saturdays, as well as on the evenings before holidays. It offers you different themes and atmospheres every evening.

item.title: Le Thé dansant
item.body: Sorry no text in English

item.title: De Confrater
item.body: Probably the best Student Bar in the world... Party, party and party

item.title: Baroque Café
item.body: Gay bar for 30- 40 y.o. men and bears, everyone is welcome !! One of the most friendly bars in Brussels, without attitude.

item.title: La Réserve
item.body: La Reserve is the oldest gay bar in Brussels, and somewhat of an institution in the city. This cafe has an old-style feel to it. Locals and tourists alike with mixed ages... La Reserve had a friendly atmosphere, an updated sound system and great music, especially on weekends when the place fills to capacity. Open daily from 3 PM

item.title: Tels Quels
item.body: Cafe and bar of the Tels Quels community and counselling centre for gays and lesbians

item.title: Boysboudoir
item.body: Stylish modern bar with the balance between latino heath and New York hardness, according to themselves. Boy's Boudoir is a typical Brussels style gay bar with lots of colour local.

item.title: Le Club
item.body: Popular cocktail bar. Busy on week end. Nice atmosphere.

item.title: Delecta
item.body: A place full of soul, next to Flagey, différent wines to discover. Every Thursday, "les apéro du Delecta"

item.title: Kawa
item.body: Kawa offers a varied menu consisting of : Homemade ice cream, sweet and savory crepes, waffles and sandwiches. All in a modern and pleasant place !

item.title: Banco Bar
item.body:
Open7/7 • 09:00am > 02:00am
Kitchen non-stop • 12:00 > 23:00

item.title: Scott's
item.body:
Located in front of "The Cat on a bike" on Rue Montagnes aux Herbes Potageres, Brussels, Belgium.
 
Just 200m from Gare Central in Brussels, this newly opened bar offers an international feel with an extensive cocktail menu with beers and whiskeys from all over the world.
 
The building dates back to 1865 and is a typical example of Facadisme in Belgium by Paul Saintenoy.
 
With DJ sets on a regular basis, we also take bookings for parties and functions with a large mezzanine upstairs overlooking the bar, ideal for a private function.
 
 
Drinks 
 
We offer an extensive range of cocktails and shooters including Mojitos, Margaritas, Mai Tais, Martinis and much more.
 
The bar has a large international feel to the bar stocking bottled beers from all over the world including some of Belgium's favourites.
 
On tap you will find Guinness (served the right way!), and a selection of ales, lagers and cider.
 
If it is a fine whiskey or scotch you are looking for we have it, from Ireland Scotland and furter afield. Glenlivet, Glenfiddich, Highland Park, Ardmore are just a small sample on offer.

item.title: Potemkine
item.body:
One of the latest creations from Frédéric Nicolay, young HoReCa-designer-guru! And again a big success! A friendly and trendy café/cinema with, on screen, some great classics and art-house productions and, by way of interior, a gigantic whale skeleton!

Sun., Tue. & Wed. 10.30 p.m. till 1 a.m., Thu. till Sat. 10.30 till 3 a.m.
item.address: Avenue de la Porte de Hal 2/Hallepoortlaan 2

item.title: Coco Bar
item.body:
Restaurant and bar both cool and cosy set up in the heart of the European district, with the focus, above all, on variety: of nationalities, of the drinks, of the menus and of styles of music. Packed on weekdays, closed weekends.

When: Open Mon-Wed > 11 p.m., Thu-Fri > midnight

item.title: The Old Oak
item.body: Irish Bar situated in the heart of the Brussels business quarter, Serving hearty and wholesome Irish food to the masses, The bar itself look like it just came over on the Ferry complete with real Irish characters, From Cork on the most part, Serving the black stuff and driving on the craic.

item.title: Madame Moustache
item.body:
Madame Moustache is neo-cabaret in the heart of Brussels, on the Place du Marché aux Poissons, a stone's throw from Ste. Catherine. Expect an original and people-friendly atmosphere, which will take you back to the Edwardian era!

When : 7 p.m. till 4 a.m.

item.title: Chaff
item.body:
Alternatif bar in the heart of les Marolles. Tasty dishes, lots of games, exhibitions, concerts parties,… they have it all.
 
When : 8.30 a.m. till 2 a.m.

item.title: Lord Byron
item.body:
Arty but discrete bar, a well kept sectret, perfect for an intimate conversation, for those who like PJ Harvey and Lou Reed.

When: 5 p.m. till 5 a.m.

item.title: London Calling
item.body:
Cool musical hangout bar with really friendly atmosphere near Place de Londres! Live funk & soul music 3 nights a week, concerts in a steamy basement and great selection of whiskeys!

When: 4 p.m. till midnight; WE 4 p.m. till 2 a.m. (closed on Sunday)

item.title: Café Maison du Peuple
item.body:
Located at the radiant and animated Parvis Saint de Gilles, this bar got recently renovated. It has an industrial New Yorkish appeal which makes the perfect decoration for the many concerts, expo’s and parties.

When: Open > 1 a.m., Fri and Sat > 3 a.m.

item.title: Moeder Lambic Fontainas
item.body:
Hundreds of beers including a wide selection on draught, in the top 10.

When : 11 a.m till 01 a.m. , Fri. & Sat. till 2 a.m.

item.title: Moeder Lambic Original
item.body: Beer is the answer

item.title: Café Bocage
item.body: Located in front of the city hall of Saint-Gilles

item.title: Le Dauphin
item.body: The caffee is situated nearby the city hall of Saint-Gilles

item.title: The Grapevine
item.body: This Belgian ’brasserie’ at the Place du Luxembourg offers besides traditionnalsd dishes, an Indian buffet at noon

item.title: Laloona
item.body: Located near the ’barrière de Saint-Gilles’, the road has been recently renovated

item.title: Bonnefooi
item.body:
A safe bet for nightlife in Brussels: dance until the early hours here - Amazing mezzanine and programmes that leave you open-mouthed (DJ jamming session exhibition).

When : 4 p.m. till 8 a.m.

item.title: Brasserie Verschueren
item.address: 11-13 Parvis de Saint Gilles /11-13 Sint-Gillis voorplein

item.title: LE FONOGRAF Cantine ArtCafé
item.body:
Recently opened in October 2011, Le Fonograf is born out of the initiative of three dynamic and night-loving youngsters - a Congolese deejay, a Belgian painter and an Italian sociologist - with high ambitions and a low budget. On this premise, the Canteen and Art-Café is a versatile bar just two steps away from Brussels' Grand Place, the city's main square. It is imagined as a space which can contemporaneously hold exhibitions, workshops for children, wine-tasting sessions and live music (both jazz concerts and deejay mixing). Le Fonograf caters to a wide range of audiences at different moments of the day and night, reflecting the city's cosmopolitan and neighbourly atmosphere. The Canteen proposes a simple and changing menu, which ranges from soups and sandwiches to the less known Flammekeuche, some presented in an original way as the "Gamelle du Midi" or the evening combos to be tasted with a bottle of local beer or wine. Enhanced by those clients that stay to read the daily press or play with the different games at their disposal, the familiar atmosphere might suddenly change as the Canteen shifts to Art-Café: you might encounter students of the conservatory or Art School close-by that start off an improvised jam session, or pass when the weekly program offers live concert and dj sets. Each day is different at Le Fonograf, it is up to you to make the best out of a place where it is impossible not to feel at home and will live for sure an unexpected and unpredictable experience!

When : 10 a.m. till 1 a.m.; WE noon till 2 a.m.

item.title: Flip Bar
item.body:
A small and cosy bar with a vintage spirit and exhibitions of young artists on the walls near Flagey! The Switch parties on Friday evening are notorious! The music is very eclectic and always of good quality.

When: Mon. to Thu. 4 p.m. till 1 a.m., Sat. 4 p.m. till 2 a.m., Sun. 4 p.m. till 1 a.m.

item.title: L'Amour Fou
item.body:
Apart from a chill bar with tasty burgers, L’Amour Fou is a place live music and art rule! Convivial concerts, exhibitions changing every month, but also workshops, movies and sharing of the lust for life.

When: 11 a.m. till 1 a.m.; WE 11 a.m. till 3 a.m.

item.title: Via via café - Micromarché
item.body:
International food, organic drinks, inside terrace, Belgian beer, cocktails, receptions, concerts, expo, ...Inside terrace, free Wi-Fi, free press

When: 11 a.m. till 11 p.m.

item.title: Tigre
item.body: A Belgo-Vietnamese brasserie, is that a first? First or not, that’s what Thanh, from Brussels himself but with Vietnamese roots, has set up. In corner premises a stone’s throw from Flageyplein/place Flagey, he has transformed a former pizzeria into a spacious, pleasant bar/cafe, somewhere in between an old-fashioned Belgian bar and a Vietnamese restaurant. The interior was designed by the Brussels architect Simon de Wrangel. Thanh himself, along with some capable acquaintances, did the work on the retro interior, with its exotic touches. His establishment is called Tigre because the tiger is a kind of symbol of Vietnam. Soon, moreover, you’ll be able to get Tiger beer from Vietnam there.

item.title: Hard Rock Café Brussels
item.body:
Belgium’s capital gets ready to rock, as the iconic Hard Rock Cafe makes its way to Brussels! Hard Rock International is pleased to announce plans to bring the brand’s one-of-a-kind blend of music, entertainment and authentic scratch-based cuisine to Brussels, with a state-of-the-art location showcasing Hard Rock’s new design style and latest technology. The multi-level location, located in the heart of the city’s historic Grand Place, will be sure to contend as one of the Brussels’ premier dining and entertainment destinations.
 
Hard Rock Cafe Brussels will be complete with both indoor and outdoor dining areas including upscale design features and innovative technology, featuring the Rock Wall™ Solo, an interactive touch wall featuring technology enabling fans to explore the world’s greatest rock ‘n’ roll memorabilia collection and virtually tour all of the company’s 174 venues around the world. In addition, memorabilia from Hard Rock’s iconic collection will adorn the walls of Hard Rock Cafe Brussels, including items from legendary musicians from around the world, as well as today’s top contemporary artists.
 
To blend the city’s bohemian, eclectic feel with the energy and vibe of the Hard Rock brand, the cafe is located in a restored 16th Century building and will deliver a Hard Rock experience unique to the City of Brussels. The cafe will have more than 5,800 square-feet of space, including spacious seating for 150, a live music area for weekly events, a late night lounge and a merchandise-filled Rock Shop.
 
For more than 40 years, Hard Rock has offered guests classic American fare in a rock ‘n’ roll atmosphere. Hard Rock Cafe Brussels will be the ideal location to showcase the brand’s world-famous cuisine, including Hard Rock’s Legendary Burgers, signature Smokehouse items and more. In addition to its food, Hard Rock offers unmatched specialty drinks from its award-winning bar menu, from Hurricanes and Margaritas, to its Alternative Rock non-alcoholic beverage menu featuring favorites like Wildberry Smoothies and Crushed Velvet “martinis.”
 
The Brussels cafe’s Rock Shop, will offer rock ‘n’ roll-inspired items, as well as favorite collectible Hard Rock Cafe Brussels merchandise in its exclusive retail location. This Brussels-specific merchandise can only be purchased at this location, offering an exclusive design quality that enhances each item’s appeal. Fans can also acquire Hard Rock’s much-coveted signature pins, including new, limited-edition Brussels pins, which reflect the spirit of the city and the authenticity of Hard Rock’s merchandise.

item.title: Au Vieux Spijtigen Duivel
item.body: This historic inn dates from the mid-18th century and has since become a listed building. When you walk into the cafe, you will be transported back to the days when Hugo, Baudelaire and the Uccle municipal council used to drop in here for a drink.

item.title: Cobra café
item.body: The Cobra has fun playing around with humour and surrealism, as demonstrated by the very funny "Niet op het gras komen A.U.B." - "Ne pas marcher sur le gazon" - "Don't walk on the grass" - a rather surrealist warning in a 100% urban setting that doubles up as an exhibition venue. In fact, the Cobra has two functions, bar and gallery. Sipping a Vedett on its terrace is a great way of whiling away a summer's day.

item.title: Café Georgette
item.body:
The Café Georgette is a friendly bar situated right bang at the heart of the capital. It takes its name from Georgette, who was Magritte's muse and wife.

Open every day from 10 a.m. to midnight.

item.title: Flamingo
item.body:
8:00 a.m - 2:00 a.m
Breakfast - lunch - Apero

item.title: La Touche d'Ivoire
Bier Circus
item.body:
From Tuesday to Friday: 11am to 23 pm
Saterday: 18 pm to 23 pm

item.title: Le Pantin
item.body: Le Pantin is one of the few remaining typical Brussels cafés where generations of chess players, go players, students and connoisseurs of sophisticated artisanal beers continue to gather. Officially one of the world's top 100 cafés - no less - it is also a haven of timelessness, with its unusual, characterful décor and famous patron Jean-Marie, the life and soul of the place!

item.title: Brasserie de l'Union
item.body: A real institution in Saint Gilles! Public eclectic, good-natured atmosphere, good beer, excellent homemade lasagna, a terrace full of charm, ambience, not making head blablatent people calmly sipping their beer!
item.address: 55 Parvis de St Gilles/55 Sint Gillis Voorplein

item.title: Volle Gas
item.body: Restaurant, typical brussels and flemish cuisine: stoemp, waterzooi, carbonnades and mussels,...

item.title: Au Daringman
item.body: A visit to Brussels Sint Katelijnewijk/Quartier St. Catherine is not complete without an afternoon visit to the 'au Daringman' - a real Brussels brown café. "Bruin" cafés in Brussels are rapidly disappearing but this one is still around thanks to the social and artistic village atmosphere of this small café in the big city. Stop by and have a drink, Martine the proprietor will appreciate your visit and she can help you in any of the languages on the compass points around Bru-town: Dutch, German, English and French.

item.title: B'artist Café
item.body:
This caffe is ideally located just off the stylish Avenue Louise and inside the prestigious hotel Le Châtelain. You can enjoy a classical continental breakfast, a delicious buffet or a breakfast à la carte.
- Chic and relaxed interior.
- Only open in the morning (7-10.30 PM, till 11 PM in the weekend)

item.title: Bar Green Witch
item.body:
Located nearby the Grand-Place in a brand new interior, this bar offers tasting of aperitifs, different beverages and thematic evenings.
- Open from 7 am until the last client leaves.

item.title: The News Bar
item.body:
The bar is located in the Hotel Silken Berlaymont, in the heart of the European neighborhood nearby the Commission.
- This elegant and comfortable bar offers you exotic cocktails and famous Belgian beers while you can admire the artistically photographed constellations by Radisic.

item.title: Wall Street Café
item.body:
Located near the European quarters, this contemporary cafe offers an international cuisine with different dishes of the day. American breakfast.
- Terrace with room for 20 seats from May till October.
- Open from 7 Pm till 8 Am.
- Closed on Saturday and Sunday.

item.title: Le Petit Canon
item.body:
(not available)
On y boit, on y mange, on y lit, on y écoute de la musique, on y papotte, on y va entre amis
 
 
Équipe culinaire Bistro, Bar à Vin, Mise en Bouche... Ambiance cosy et chaleureuse, de qualité et décontractée... on y boit, on y mange, on y lit, on y écoute de la musique, on y papotte, on y va entre amis... bref, on s'y sent chez soi !
Chaque semaine des tableaux reprennent nos différentes suggestions de vins, cocktails et petits en-cas variant selon les saisons tel que hot dogs et vin chaud pour l’hiver.WE
Les bières, softs, cafés et autres se trouvent sur la carte ainsi que nos spécialités : lazardo, thé glacé, chorizzos chauds, rillette et lupins…
Pensez aussi au petit canon pour organiser vos anniversaires et autres fêtes !!!

item.title: Barbeton
item.body: Bar

item.title: Bar en Vol
item.body:
Located in the earth of Uccle in Brussels, the Bar en Vol is for sure the ideal place to get away for the night within a modern and sophisticated environment, decorated along the theme of aviation. You will have the possibility to taste everyday different kinds of original cocktails and shooters, recreated and reinvented every week by our different bartenders. Especially at the week-end, different Dj's or musicians are programmed in order to entertain the evening until the wee hours of the morning.
 
Every summer, enjoy free "Beach Volley" and "Barbecue" located on our terrasse.

item.title: Martini bar
item.body: Over the years, Martini has built a strong reputation with its bars. The elegant Martini bar in Milano is the best example. With the stylish bar in the heart of the Louise District, the tradition goes on in our capital. The new Brussels heir is the ideal place to enjoy, after work or after shopping, a glass of sparkling Martini or Martini Royale with your colleagues or friends, followed by a delicious Fusion Cuisine diner.

item.title: Crystal Lounge
item.body:
Relaxing terrace: reserve your own terrace spot
Exclusive dining: reserve your own VIP Table
Tasty brunch: enjoy a friendly and tasty Sunday brunch ( free brunch for kids under 10 years)
Drinking in style: enjoy your own stylish drink (each month, the barman presents a new cocktail and its unique recipe)
Live Dj-set: early evenings have the feel of an intimate, low-key lounge. Later in the evening the energy level increases as Crystal Lounge hosts top local, regional and national DJ’s (every Thursday, Friday & Saturday night)

item.title: "Café Poussette" Haricot Magique
item.body:
The "Café Poussette" by Haricot Magique is a warm, cosy place for children and their parents where everything has been thought of to make families feel at ease. It's the right place to take a break with the kids, to have a drink or a snack or to simply have a chat with other parents and swap information about all the good addresses in town. And the little ones can play with their friends in the kids' room.
 
High chairs, parking space for strollers, washroom for babies, healthy food for the family, everything is there to welcome you and your young children.
Haricot Magique's café poussette is also a boutique where you'll find original toys for children aged 8-10, clothing collections, childcare items, accessories and a series of practical, ethical and fun articles selected with utmost care.

item.title: La Place Art Bar
item.body:
La Place Art Bar would like to put growing artists in the spotlight by showing their works around our bar. All this, to create an amazing atmosphere. A festive environment, accompanied with a good glass of wine and some saulty snacks, this is what you will find at the "La Place Art Bar".
Additional to that, while you're enjoying your drink, don't hesitate to have a closer look at the paintings and we even invite you to dream away for a couple of moments in the Art around you.
That's how Art can be brought to all of us!
You can benefit all year long our heated and covered terrace.
At 22h we start our dancing part with one of our many resident dj's.
Every thursday, there are free Salsa courses from 20h until 22h30, followed by a steaming "Latino" evening.
You can find oud agenda and our many theme-nights on our Facebook
fanpage: la Place Art Bar.

item.title: Les Parents Terribles
item.body: Since end of April you can take your offspring to “Les Parents Terribles”, a new child- and baby-friendly café in Saint-Gilles, much like Café Poussette in Schaerbeek. In its vintage setting, the café offers catering for young and old based on local produce. There’s obviously a playroom. And “Les Parents Terribles” also organizes various morning activities.

item.title: Le Plattesteen
item.body: Taverne - Headquarters for the gay village

item.title: Dolores
item.body: Small, cosy bar with a mature clientele.

item.title: Playground
item.body:
Lun - mar: 16:00 - 00:30
mer - sam: 16:00 - 02:00

item.title: Floréo
item.body:
Atypical, cosy and informal; a place to taste quality cocktails or to eat something from our small home-made kitchen, open non-stop…
In the heart of Brussels, downtown area, free events as regular as varied: milonga of Argentinian Tango, musical quizz, jam sessions and live music and much more…
 
Daily nternational newspapers, wi-fi and a whole panoply of board games are placed at the your disposal, every day, from morning till late at night
Atypical, cosy and informal; a place to taste quality cocktails or to eat something from our small home-made kitchen, open non-stop…

item.title: Corica
item.body:
Corica: The perfect place to enjoy a coffee of excellence in the heart of Brussels.
 
 
Corica is an artisan coffee bar located just a few steps from The Grand Place, roasting its beans on the spot to serve only the freshest coffee. The smell of roasting beans filling the streets will help guide you towards the café. Corica can help you travel the world through its offer of 27 arabica coffees, each with a flavor unique to its country of origin.
 
Corica gives their customers the choice of either savoring the tastes of coffee at their traditional café or buying fresh beans from their wide selection. All beans are freshly ground to match your coffee machine.
 
The baristas are on hand to advise and serve the coffee according to your preference: strong, mild, fruity, espresso, ristretto, latte, mocha latte, etc.
 
Come and discover some of the best coffees in the world such as the famous Kopi Luwak from Indonesia.

item.title: De Haus
item.body: A bar brimming with vintage flair and musical entertainment galore. Nice bonus: the furniture is for sale, including the chair you’re sitting on.

item.title: Alcatraz Bar
item.body:
A 2 pas de Tour & Taxi venez passer un moment entre amis, en famille ou collègues dans un cadre hors du commun.
 
Faite un bon dans le milieu fermé carcérale de la réplique de la célèbre prison d'Alcatraz.
 

Visitez notre facebook: Alcatraz Tapas Bar afin de connaitre nos diverses soirées à thèmes.

item.title: Café Métropole
item.body:
Café Metropole, located on the vibrant Place de Brouckère, offers high-end brasserie cuisine in line with Brussels’ tradition. The Café’s new menu revives the history of this building, which was founded by the Wielemans-Ceuppens brewer’s family in 1890. You can discover a superb selection of Belgian craft beers, have a cup of tea or enjoy our refined cuisine. Besides traditional starters and main courses found at brasseries, you can enjoy our renowned chef’s specialties: Homemade duck foie gras with port jelly, the Metropole chicken burger or even Nougat glacé with red berry coulis. Children are not forgotten either: the « Kids’ Menu » has a selection of courses including Roast chicken with salad and fries.
 
 
This luxurious brasserie welcomes its guests in an Art Nouveau environment in which the original decor has been kept; both the building’s interior and exterior have been classified. Guests can choose to sit either inside, in the intimate yet lavish interior of the Café, or outside on the heated terrace, which is open all year round, to be closer to the city’s hustle and bustle. Café Metropole has 80 seats inside and 150 outside, split into two separate terraces in summer.
 
Particular care is taken to ensure the great reception and service for our clients, as well as the quality of the products offered, which is a genuine reason not to fail the standard excellence of Hotel Metropole to which the Café belongs.
 
The exchange of the traditional and excellent know-how between the interior of the Hotel, the exterior and the Café contribute to the magnetism of this mythical place where the inhabitants of Brussels have met actors, scientists, journalists and politicians for a long time. In the heart of Brussels, Café Metropole is the ideal spot to meet up with clients, take a break from shopping or simply meet other people.
 
Open Monday to Friday from 09:00 until 01:00
Open Saturday and Sunday from 10:00 until 01:00
 
 Menu
